company_description:
Asset Allocation & Management (AAM) is an asset management firm providing fixed income asset management services to insurance companies.
The company manages core fixed income assets on behalf of property & casualty and life insurance clients and offers convertible bond and high yield products through sub-advisory relationships.

Access Point Financial is a hospitality financing firm offering full-service lending.
Launched in 2011, Access Point Financial specializes in capital expenditure loans and transitional mortgage loans to franchisees of major hotel brands throughout the United States. The company develops lending programs that are endorsed, marketed and supported by the franchisors (i.e., the hotel brands).
Introduction to Clients & Partners
Stone Point introduced Access Point to our network of lending relationships to help secure warehouse funding. Additionally, Stone Point introduced Access Point to prospective borrowers and sources of business, such as franchisors and CMBS special servicers, as well as to other Trident portfolio companies and relationships who completed Access Point’s securitizations.
Operational Assistance & Governance
Stone Point worked closely with the Access Point management team in the formation of the business, in particular assisting with recruiting and selecting third-party servicers and vendors.
Exit Strategy
Stone Point facilitated the sale of Access Point to a partner who has significant ability to contribute to the company’s ongoing growth.
industry: Lending & Markets, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Achieve (formerly Freedom Financial) is a provider of consumer debt consolidation services and originates consumer and small business loans.
The company is comprised of three consumer-focused businesses: (i) Freedom Debt Relief, the nation’s largest debt settlement business, (ii) Bills.com, which generates mortgage and unsecured consumer lending leads and (iii) Freedom Asset Management, an unsecured marketplace lender.
industry: Asset Management, Business Services, Lending & Markets

company_description:
Alliant Insurance Services is a leading specialty insurance broker placing P&C and employee benefits coverages on behalf of clients throughout the U.S.
The company provides property and casualty insurance and employee benefit services to more than 55,000 clients served nationwide, including public entities, tribal nations, healthcare, energy, law firms, real estate, construction and other industry groups. Alliant is based in Newport Beach, California, and has offices throughout the United States.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
As of our initial investment in Alliant, Stone Point had been studying the insurance distribution “elephant” for more than 15 years and has completed numerous investments in the industry. In addition, we have completed a number of investments in various forms of insurance underwriters and services providers to the industry. We studied Alliant extensively before its 2005 LBO and tracked the company thereafter.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
We have facilitated introductions for Alliant to other portfolio companies as well as to broader relationships, leading to millions of dollars of recurring annual revenue for Alliant.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assists management with all material add-on acquisitions. We played a key role in helping Alliant acquire Mesirow Insurance Services, one of the Midwest’s leading independent insurance agencies, which increased Alliant’s revenue by more than $100 million.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
We have leveraged our network to enhance Alliant’s existing insurance carrier relationships and to facilitate new carrier introductions. We have also helped the company evaluate business line expansion opportunities and alternative distribution strategies.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
We have led the process for all of Alliant’s financings since the initial investment in 2015.

Allied Benefit Systems is a leading independent third-party administrator of group health benefits to self-insured employers. 
Allied provides customized benefits solutions, medical management and cost control strategies to self-insured employer groups across the U.S. The company offers a broad array of network options, pharmacy solutions and care management strategies to enable its customers to reduce costs and drive improved member satisfaction.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Human Capital Management, Insurance Services

company_description:
AloStar Bank of Commerce was an FDIC-assisted acquisition of nationwide correspondent bank.
AloStar was established to acquire the business of Nexity Bank from the FDIC in April 2011. In connection with the purchase of Nexity Bank, AloStar entered into a loss-sharing arrangement with the FDIC that provides significant protection against potential credit deterioration in the legacy loan portfolio. AloStar uses an Internet deposit-gathering platform to originate and fund asset-based commercial loans for small and mid-sized businesses. The company was sold to State Bank Financial of Georgia in 2017.
status_current: Past							 | Acquired by State Bank Financial

company_description:
Alterra Capital was a global specialty insurance and reinsurance company with headquarters in Bermuda.
The company was formed on May 12, 2010 by the merger of Max Capital Group Ltd. (NASDAQ: MXGL) and Harbor Point Limited, which Trident III had formed in 2005 in partnership with Chubb Corporation. In December 2012, Alterra entered into a definitive agreement to merge with Markel Corp. (NYSE: MKL).
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point assisted Markel with the rating agency process and regulatory approval process (secured “A” rating from A.M. Best vs. “A-” for most start-ups).
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point made an executive-level introduction of Markel to an important quota share partner, PARIS RE.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point led the diligence, negotiation and documentation for the merger of Harbor Point and Max Capital. Additionally, Stone Point structured a renewal rights transaction with Chubb as well as quota share and transition services agreements.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point recruited Markel’s CFO, CAO, Legal Counsel and Outside Directors.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point secured over $1billion of capital from outside investors. Stone Point also assisted in structuring and raising capital for two “side-car” transactions.

AOP is a national physician-led and physician-owned orthopedic practice focused on enhancing clinical value and reducing claims costs for commercial and workers’ compensation payors.
AOP is a mission-based national orthopedic practice that operates through a proven physician- and locally-led model focused on enhancing clinical value and access for each of its patients, employers and payors. Through our investments in the workers’ compensation and managed care verticals, we have studied the evolution of payment models and, more specifically, the increased focus by payors on driving better clinical outcomes to reduce claims costs. We partnered with the AOP team to pursue the buildout of a national orthopedic practice to address these market dynamics.

Amherst is a provider of brokerage and advisory services covering the residential and commercial mortgage markets.
Amherst is a financial services holding company that offers global institutional investors investment banking, asset management and advisory services focused on the residential and commercial mortgage and related structured finance markets. The company has differentiated itself through its development of proprietary analytical tools and methodologies. Trident was the lead investor in Amherst Holdings’ August 2008 capital raise and has supported the company’s asset management strategies, including the formation of Main Street Renewal LLC, a company engaged in the business of acquiring single family properties and converting them to leasable homes.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Amherst Pierpont Securities is a fixed-income broker-dealer.
Amherst Pierpont was formed in 2010 as a de novo broker-dealer focused on the U.S. government securities market. In October 2014, Amherst Holdings and Pierpont Securities closed on the combination of their broker-dealer businesses, which were renamed Amherst Pierpont Securities. The company provides its customers, including institutional investors, hedge funds and asset managers, with liquidity and execution services in connection with trading U.S. treasury securities, government-sponsored entity securities, mortgage-backed securities, credit and repurchase agreements.
industry: Lending & Markets, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
AmTrust Financial is a multinational property and casualty insurance company specializing in coverage for small businesses.
Through its primary insurance subsidiaries rated “A-” (Excellent) by A.M. Best, the company offers property and casualty insurance products, including workers’ compensation, commercial automobile, general liability and extended service and warranty coverage.

APCO is a marketer and administrator of auto extended warranties sold through auto dealers in North America.
Automobile Protection Corporation (APCO) is a leading marketer and administrator of vehicle service contracts (VSCs) and complementary products sold by auto dealers in the U.S. and a network of independent and captive agents that specialize in serving the auto dealer community.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point has been studying the warranty and extended service contract administration industry as an “elephant” since 2000.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point provided APCO with executive-level introductions to insurance carriers as well as senior-level introductions to lenders and institutional investors.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assisted with the structuring and financing of several key acquisitions, including the acquisitions of GWC Warranty Corporation in 2013 and Automobile Development Group in 2016.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
With Stone Point’s guidance and an infusion of capital, APCO invested in new products during the financial downturn that ultimately enabled the company to recover quickly when the market conditions became more favorable.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point worked with APCO to complete several debt-financed transactions, including debt recapitalizations, dealer-advance financing and the sale-leaseback of the building housing the company’s headquarters.
EXIT STRATEGY
Stone Point was instrumental in negotiating the sale of APCO to a partner who is able to add significant value. Stone Point retained an equity interest in APCO and facilitated the transition to the buyer.

Applied Systems is the leading global provider of cloud-based software to the P&C and benefits insurance industries. 
Recognized as a pioneer in insurance automation, the company provides agency and brokerage management systems to customers throughout North America and Europe. Applied is based in University Park, Illinois, and has offices throughout the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.

ARC is a leading management and professional liability wholesale broker.
The company specializes in professional liability products and services, including directors and officers, errors and omissions, and other specialty coverages distributed through several hundred regional brokers.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point has extensive experience in the specialty wholesale brokerage space.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point has introduced ARC to a number of Trident portfolio companies, including several retail brokers that have partnered with ARC on new business opportunities.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point has facilitated introductions to insurance companies that are seeking to increase their distribution through specialist program managers such as ARC.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point worked with CEO Chris Cavallaro to develop an equity incentive plan that has provided the next generation of producers an opportunity to own a substantial stake in the business.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has helped raise debt at the holding company in order to optimize the Company’s capital structure and introduce leverage on a basis acceptable to management.

Arch Capital (NASDAQ: ACGL) is a Bermuda-based insurance and reinsurance company that writes specialty lines of insurance and reinsurance on a global basis through operations in Bermuda and the United States.
Arch Capital is the successor to Risk Capital Holdings, Inc., which was originally established in 1995 by Trident.

Ascensus is a leading provider of technology-enabled administration services to the tax-advantaged savings market. 
Ascensus primarily serves as an independent retirement plan recordkeeper, retirement plan third-party administrator and 529 plan administrator. The company serves over 15 million savers across the United States with more than $740 billion in assets under administration.

Atlantic Capital is a full-service commercial bank with operations in Georgia and Tennessee.
Atlantic Capital is a community bank with a loan portfolio composed of middle-market commercial and industrial loans, as well as commercial real estate loans. The bank expanded into the Chattanooga and Knoxville, Tennessee markets through its 2015 merger with First Security Group, Inc. (FSGI).

Atrium is a London-based Lloyd’s Managing Agency that manages Syndicate 609.
Atrium has a proven track record of generating underwriting profits across market cycles and has produced underwriting profits every year since it was founded in 1994. The purchase of Atrium also included the acquisition of Arden Reinsurance Company Ltd., a Class IV Bermuda reinsurer that provides a 65% quota share for the portion of the syndicate for which Atrium provides capital.

AXIS, a Bermuda-based global insurance and reinsurance company, was formed in November 2001 in response to the significant market dislocation that occurred following the events of September 11, 2001.
The company focuses on specialty insurance lines, such as marine and energy, aviation and aerospace, war, commercial property and political risk, as well as a number of property and specialty classes of reinsurance. AXIS trades on the NYSE: AXS.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
AXIS was the first and largest de novo company formation after the events of September 11, 2001. Critical to its early success was the strength of Stone Point’s network and sponsorship.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point’s relationships with leading brokers accelerated the launch of the business and helped establish the company as a leading underwriter of specialized risks.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point recruited the senior management team to lead AXIS and recruited a “best-in-class” board of directors.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
As lead investor, Stone Point assembled the equity sponsor group, which capitalized the company with $1.7 billion initially. This substantial capital raise facilitated the company’s A.M. Best rating.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
We assisted with AXIS’s immediate launch, including securing infrastructure and regulatory and rating agency approvals. Stone Point also helped the company’s management team create a budgeting process and develop strategic and financial reviews of key initiatives.
EXIT STRATEGY
Stone Point was instrumental in AXIS’s initial public offering.

B.H. Acquisition Limited is a Bermuda-based holding company that owns two insurance companies in run-off.
B.H. Acquisition is managed by Castlewood Holdings Limited, a former Trident portfolio company, and validated the run-off investment thesis for Trident prior to the fund’s larger capital commitment to Castlewood (now Enstar Group Limited).
Bay Point Holdings Limited is a special purpose “side car” vehicle formed to reinsure the short-tail business written by Harbor Point Limited, a former Trident portfolio company.

Beeline is a leading provider of extended workforce management software supporting global enterprises.
Beeline’s software helps procurement, sourcing and human resources professionals optimize costs, reduce risks and add value to their services procurement and contingent workforce programs. The platform manages over $68 billion in annual contingent labor spend with programs in over 120 countries and across all industries, with a focus on financial services, technology, healthcare and professional services.

Black Mountain Systems is a leading provider of innovative workflow software solutions to credit investors and alternative asset managers
The company’s clients, which include leading managers of fixed income and alternative assets in the U.S. and Europe, utilize Black Mountain’s Everest platform to increase operating efficiency and reduce risk.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point assisted Black Mountain with sales and marketing, including numerous successful client introductions. Stone Point supported management with the expansion into new client end markets, including direct lending, commercial banks, alternative assets, investment consultants and insurance companies.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point leveraged its experience in the asset & wealth management technology software space to guide management’s focus toward maximizing higher-value, recurring-revenue streams and helped streamline the contracting process to enhance client retention and growth. Stone Point also implemented best governance practices at the board level and introduced value-added independent directors.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point played a key role in helping Black Mountain execute its first tuck-in acquisition, which improved the company’s competitive positioning in direct lending.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point facilitated all of Black Mountain’s third-party debt financings, providing capital to make distributions and to complete its first acquisition. Stone Point also assisted in creating a management incentive plan to increase alignment and management participation in value creation.
industry: Asset Management, Wealth Management & Fund Administration

company_description:
BridgePoint is a personal lines insurance broker focused on the high-net-worth market.
The company was founded in 1979 and provides insurance and financial services nationwide with concentrations in the greater New York City area, Coastal New England and Florida. BridgePoint is currently licensed in all 50 states, allowing the company to cost-effectively insure client assets in multiple locations. In addition, BridgePoint operates a high-touch customer service model, handling claims on behalf of customers on a 24×7 basis.

Broadstone Net Lease (“BNL”) is an internally-managed real estate investment trust (“REIT”) focused on single-tenant commercial real estate properties in the United States.
Broadstone Net Lease is an internally-managed REIT that acquires, owns and manages primarily single-tenant commercial real estate properties that are net leased on a long-term basis to a diversified group of tenants. BNL’s diversified portfolio consists of properties in the U.S. and Canada across the industrial, healthcare, restaurant, retail and office property types.
Stone Point originally invested in BNL’s investment manager, Broadstone Real Estate (“BRE”), which served as the investment manager for BNL and Broadtree Residential (“BTR”), a private real estate investment vehicle that invests in multifamily properties in multiple U.S. markets. In 2020, through a series of transactions involving the acquisition of the manager, BNL and its board of directors internalized the external management functions performed for BNL by Broadstone Real Estate and its affiliates, resulting in Stone Point’s ownership of BNL’s REIT shares.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point sourced several property investments for Broadstone Net Lease. Stone Point has also sourced and helped evaluate a number of potential acquisition opportunities.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
During its ownership of the investment manager, Stone Point helped BRE evaluate strategic opportunities, including expanding the Broadtree Residential vehicle into multifamily investments and launching new investment vehicles. Stone Point also helped assess BRE’s decision to sell its single-family homes portfolio and outsource property management for its residential properties. Additionally, through the internalization of the manager, BNL will benefit from a simplified structure, immediate cost savings related to fees associated with BRE, and further alignment of the management team within BNL.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has assisted BRE in raising additional equity for its investment vehicles through introducing the company to wealth advisory firms and other distribution partners within our network. Additionally, Stone Point helped BRE raise third-party debt for the first time at the manager and helped increase its lender group in its investment vehicle.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point worked with BRE’s management to put in place an equity participation plan for a broad set of employees to improve alignment.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Cross Ocean Partners is a credit-focused asset management platform investing globally in stressed and distressed investment opportunities in a broad range of asset classes.
Cross Ocean invests in asset classes including corporate loans and bonds, hard assets, commercial real estate, liquidations and structured credit. Cross Ocean was launched by Chief Executive Officer Graham Goldsmith and Trident. The company acquired its European Special Situations investment platform in July 2015 and has $7.3 billion of AUM as of September 30, 2023.

Eagle Point is an asset manager formed in 2012 by Trident and Tom Majewski. Eagle Point invests in structured credit securities, including the equity and junior debt tranches of collateralized loan obligations (CLOs) as well as debt of BDCs and loan funds.
Eagle Point has focused on investing in majority equity stakes in newly issued CLOs managed by proven collateral managers. As the majority equity investor in these CLOs, Eagle Point negotiates preferred economic terms that enable the funds to generate enhanced returns.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point’s relationships across the structured finance landscape, including with investment banks, CLO managers and private equity issuers, have facilitated Eagle Point’s growth.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point capitalized on its close relationships with investment banks to attract underwriting interest in Eagle Point, which at the time had only a 1.5-year track-record. Stone Point’s relationship ensured senior-level focus on a relatively small public offering for Eagle Point Credit Company (NYSE: ECC), which has subsequently been upsized through follow-on offerings.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point has provided ongoing assistance in evaluating acquisitions and organic expansion opportunities, most notably the December 2016 acquisition of a CLO platform (rebranded as Marble Point Credit Management), which was subsequently sold to Investcorp in 2023.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
At the company’s outset, Stone Point collaborated with Eagle Point’s senior management team to develop a business plan, financial model and fund structuring. Trident has provided seed capital to launch each of the company’s new product initiatives.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point has helped management build the necessary infrastructure as well as recruit additional candidates to broaden and strengthen the team over time.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has facilitated introductions that have led to more than $2 billion of third-party capital, primarily from Trident fund limited partners and other close relationships.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point provided Eagle Point with back-office, compliance and legal support as the company was developing its infrastructure. Stone Point has made introductions to leading third-party vendors to provide compliance and HR assistance, where appropriate.

Henderson Park Capital is a real estate asset management platform that targets multi-strategy, value-add and opportunistic real estate investments in major European markets and the U.S. Henderson Park has invested over $13 billion across all major real estate asset classes in prime locations in Europe and U.S.
The company focuses on acquiring and repositioning assets that are undermanaged, underutilized or require a repositioned capital structure. Henderson Park was launched by Nick Weber and Trident VI in May 2016.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point leveraged its network to introduce Henderson Park to its LPs, potential investments and operating partners.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point assisted management with setting the strategic direction of the business, as well as with the selection and structuring of agreement with fund placement agent.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point assisted in recruiting and interviewing several senior hires.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point was integral to Henderson Park’s fundraising for its first fund, including introducing Henderson Park to our network of limited partners and other relationships, which resulted in several Trident LPs investing in Henderson Park’s fund including two of our existing LPs acting as cornerstone investors in the fund (with a $250 million LP investment). Additionally, Stone Point assisted in negotiating the fund’s subscription facility, and assisted in the fundraising of Henderson Park’s next two institutional funds and various co-investment vehicles.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point leveraged its experience in launching asset managers to provide guidance on the build-out of Henderson Park’s infrastructure.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Rialto is a vertically integrated commercial real estate investment and asset management platform. 
The company’s investment management platform has raised more than $13 billion since inception and currently manages $8 billion of equity as of November 2023. In addition, Rialto is a rated CMBS special servicer overseeing a portfolio of more than $90 billion in remaining pool balance.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services
hq: Miami, FL and New York, NY

company_description:
Consilio is a leading global provider of eDiscovery, document review, flexible legal talent and legal technology consulting services.
The company supports multinational law firms and corporations using innovative software, cost-effective managed services and deep legal and regulatory industry experience.

Gordon Brothers is a global advisory, restructuring and investment firm. 
Since 1903, Gordon Brothers has helped businesses maximize liquidity and asset values through its people, expertise and capital. The firm’s integrated solutions across asset services, trading and lending give clients the insights, strategies and time to optimize asset values throughout the business cycle. With over 30 offices globally, Gordon Brothers works across the full spectrum of assets with expertise in retail, commercial, industrial, brands and real estate.

Kroll is a leading provider of technology-enabled professional and business services, supporting clients with risk and financial advisory solutions. 
The company has an established franchise and diverse list of clients, including approximately half of the companies in the S&P 500 and many of the largest private equity firms, hedge funds and law firms.

LegalShield is a leading provider of subscription-based pre-paid legal and identity theft protection plans to individuals, families and businesses across the U.S. and Canada.
Services are provided to approximately 2 million active members through a network of dedicated law firms and identity theft monitoring partners.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point leveraged its extensive experience and network to help expand LegalShield’s employee benefits presence through introductions to benefit brokers and corporate clients. Stone Point also facilitated distribution relationships with multiple benefits administration platforms.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point helped enhance LegalShield’s reporting framework to prioritize long-term value creation, as well as assist in the transition of the company’s largest vendor relationship, resulting in significant savings.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point worked with LegalShield to evaluate, negotiate, execute, and finance the company’s first major tuck-in acquisition in more than 20 years.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point helped recruit several members of LegalShield’s senior management team and established an equity incentive plan for the company.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has facilitated multiple third-party debt financings, which have been critical to fund a tuck-in acquisition and return capital to shareholders. Also, less than a year and a half into its ownership of LegalShield, Stone Point secured a minority recapitalization with a longstanding Stone Point relationship, which validated the company’s progress and provided partial liquidity to shareholders.

Stretto is a technology and legal services partner providing consumer bankruptcy, corporate restructuring, claims administration and depository solutions to fiduciaries and regulatory agencies.
As a market leader in the consumer and corporate bankruptcy administration space, the company has approximately half of U.S. Chapter 7 panel trustees as clients and administers a quarter of all bankruptcy filings requiring the use of a claims and noticing agent. Stretto is one of the largest non-bank providers of depository services to the bankruptcy and legal claims administration markets.

Allied Benefit Systems is a leading independent third-party administrator of group health benefits to self-insured employers. 
Allied provides customized benefits solutions, medical management and cost control strategies to self-insured employer groups across the U.S. The company offers a broad array of network options, pharmacy solutions and care management strategies to enable its customers to reduce costs and drive improved member satisfaction.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Human Capital Management, Insurance Services

company_description:
Enlyte (formerly Mitchell|Genex|Coventry) is a leading provider of claims software, cost containment and technology-enabled solutions to the workers’ compensation, auto and disability insurance industries. 
Enlyte delivers a comprehensive suite of solutions to their established client base of over 650 P&C carriers, TPAs and other claims payers. The company is led by Alex Sun.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Services

company_description:
Genex is a leading managed care services firm providing case and utilization management, independent medical exams, medical bill review and other ancillary medical cost-containment services to insurance companies, employers and third-party administrators of workers’ compensation, disability and auto claims.
In addition, Genex provides services on behalf of claimants through a national Social Security representation program.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Genex developed meaningful new business operations through Stone Point’s network.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point made executive-level introductions of Genex to large potential customers and secured continuity of existing contracts with key customers.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assisted on five acquisitions that increased Genex’s scale in core product offerings, provided the company with the ability to sell additional in-house services to acquired customers, and provided meaningful synergies.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point has reengineered Genex’s executive compensation plan and helped to implement a management equity investment and incentive program.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point facilitated efforts to secure acquisition debt financing and executed three recapitalizations.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Services

company_description:
Sedgwick is a leading third-party administrator (TPA) that offers customized, fully integrated, outsourced claims management solutions and focuses on serving the nation’s largest employers and the self-insurance market.
The company provides a comprehensive suite of services related to workers’ compensation, disability, liability and property claims to third parties globally. Sedgwick is a pure fee-for-service business and assumes no underwriting risk.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point assisted Sedgwick in developing a number of new business proposals and making client introductions.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assisted on numerous strategic acquisitions, including transformational acquisitions of providers of loss adjusting and specialized claims management services.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point was key in helping to recruit senior management, including the CFO.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point worked with Sedgwick management to develop the company’s stand-alone governance, operations and reporting.
EXIT STRATEGY
Stone Point was instrumental in the successful transition of Sedgwick from Trident IV and helping source KKR as a go-forward partner in 2014.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Services

company_description:
Tivity Health® Inc. is a leading provider of supplemental benefits to the Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement markets.
Tivity operates via four core brands: SilverSneakers®, a senior-focused physical and mental wellbeing solution offered through Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans, Prime® Fitness, an employer-focused fitness solution offering discounted gym memberships to employees, BurnAlong®, a digital wellness platform offering disease-specific content for the employer and seniors markets and WholeHealth Living®, an alternative and physical medicine network sold to healthcare payors.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Distribution

company_description:
Beeline is a leading provider of extended workforce management software supporting global enterprises.
Beeline’s software helps procurement, sourcing and human resources professionals optimize costs, reduce risks and add value to their services procurement and contingent workforce programs. The platform manages over $68 billion in annual contingent labor spend with programs in over 120 countries and across all industries, with a focus on financial services, technology, healthcare and professional services.

Bullhorn is a leading global software provider for the staffing, recruiting and contingent labor industry servicing over 8,500 staffing agencies in the United States, Europe and Asia.
Bullhorn’s clients rely on the company’s cloud-based platform to drive sales, build relationships, and power their recruitment processes from end to end. Headquartered in Boston, with offices around the world, Bullhorn employs more than 1,400 people globally.

Eliassen Group is a leading strategic consulting company that provides business, clinical and IT services for its clients as they seek to transform and execute strategies that will drive exceptional outcomes. 
Eliassen is focused on providing clinical solutions, professional services and talent solutions and positively impacts the lives of its employees, clients, consultants and the communities in which Eliassen operates.

Vensure is a leading provider of human capital management software and services to small- and medium-sized businesses.
Vensure offers a complete suite of cloud HCM applications covering the full spectrum of HR needs, including talent acquisition, performance management, payroll, benefits administration, workforce management and learning management. Its HCM solution is delivered both directly to clients and through third-party service providers utilizing its technology platform.

HireRight is a leading provider of employment-related background screening solutions. 
The company offers a full suite of screening solutions to large enterprise and small and midsized business customers across all major geographies and sectors, including financial services, healthcare, technology, transportation, education, retail and staffing. These services provide critical elements of workforce risk management.

Alliant Insurance Services is a leading specialty insurance broker placing P&C and employee benefits coverages on behalf of clients throughout the U.S.
The company provides property and casualty insurance and employee benefit services to more than 55,000 clients served nationwide, including public entities, tribal nations, healthcare, energy, law firms, real estate, construction and other industry groups. Alliant is based in Newport Beach, California, and has offices throughout the United States.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
As of our initial investment in Alliant, Stone Point had been studying the insurance distribution “elephant” for more than 15 years and has completed numerous investments in the industry. In addition, we have completed a number of investments in various forms of insurance underwriters and services providers to the industry. We studied Alliant extensively before its 2005 LBO and tracked the company thereafter.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
We have facilitated introductions for Alliant to other portfolio companies as well as to broader relationships, leading to millions of dollars of recurring annual revenue for Alliant.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assists management with all material add-on acquisitions. We played a key role in helping Alliant acquire Mesirow Insurance Services, one of the Midwest’s leading independent insurance agencies, which increased Alliant’s revenue by more than $100 million.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
We have leveraged our network to enhance Alliant’s existing insurance carrier relationships and to facilitate new carrier introductions. We have also helped the company evaluate business line expansion opportunities and alternative distribution strategies.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
We have led the process for all of Alliant’s financings since the initial investment in 2015.

ARC is a leading management and professional liability wholesale broker.
The company specializes in professional liability products and services, including directors and officers, errors and omissions, and other specialty coverages distributed through several hundred regional brokers.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point has extensive experience in the specialty wholesale brokerage space.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point has introduced ARC to a number of Trident portfolio companies, including several retail brokers that have partnered with ARC on new business opportunities.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point has facilitated introductions to insurance companies that are seeking to increase their distribution through specialist program managers such as ARC.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point worked with CEO Chris Cavallaro to develop an equity incentive plan that has provided the next generation of producers an opportunity to own a substantial stake in the business.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has helped raise debt at the holding company in order to optimize the Company’s capital structure and introduce leverage on a basis acceptable to management.

BridgePoint is a personal lines insurance broker focused on the high-net-worth market.
The company was founded in 1979 and provides insurance and financial services nationwide with concentrations in the greater New York City area, Coastal New England and Florida. BridgePoint is currently licensed in all 50 states, allowing the company to cost-effectively insure client assets in multiple locations. In addition, BridgePoint operates a high-touch customer service model, handling claims on behalf of customers on a 24×7 basis.
EPIC is a California-based retail property & casualty and employee benefits insurance brokerage firm founded in July 2007 by Trident IV and two leading insurance brokerage executives.

Higginbotham & Associates is the largest privately held middle-market insurance agency in Texas based on revenues and the 21st largest commercial broker in the U.S. based on the 2023 Business Insurance rankings.
Higginbotham, which is led by CEO Rusty Reid, offers P&C and employee benefits insurance coverages on behalf of middle-market clients.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point has been an active investor in the insurance distribution sector for over eighteen years, including a number of successful investments in various sub-sectors of the industry, including several investments in retail insurance brokers, wholesale brokers and program administrators. Stone Point originally met the Higginbotham management team in 2007 when the company transitioned from an employee stock ownership plan (“ESOP”) to corporate ownership and maintained an active dialogue, ultimately culminating in Stone Point’s original investment in the company in 2009.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point introduced Higginbotham to PURE, to facilitate a distribution relationship for high-net worth products. Additionally, Stone Point has helped Higginbotham develop a strong institutional-investor following and broadened the company’s access to the capital markets.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point has supported Higginbotham’s strategy of pursuing acquisitions to broaden its geographic reach and scale while complementing its strong organic revenue growth. Higginbotham has successfully acquired and integrated over 90 partnerships since Stone Point’s initial investment in 2009.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point has been a valuable partner to Higginbotham and strengthened its market position through introductions to senior business leaders in the state of Texas.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point worked extensively with management to structure a minority stake investment that fosters Higginbotham’s strong culture predicated on independence and employee ownership. Stone Point re-energized Higginbotham’s management team with several incentive plans and management / employee co-investment structure.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Since Trident VII’s investment in 2017, Stone Point has worked with management to complete several debt recapitalizations that generated over $350 million of distributions to shareholders.

Applied Systems is the leading global provider of cloud-based software to the P&C and benefits insurance industries. 
Recognized as a pioneer in insurance automation, the company provides agency and brokerage management systems to customers throughout North America and Europe. Applied is based in University Park, Illinois, and has offices throughout the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.

Harbor Group Consulting is a leading insurance consultant and due diligence advisor to the commercial real estate and commercial lending industries.
The company serves a diverse client base including large commercial banks, capital markets lenders and other financial institutions.
industry: Insurance Services, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Longevity Holdings (formerly ITM TwentyFirst) is a data and analytics provider that enables clients to manage life insurance policies and address the challenges of an aging population. 
The company utilizes proprietary data and software tools to help manage longevity risk for more than 2,000 pension fund, insurance company, bank, alternative asset manager and other corporate clients.

LTCG is a leading provider of a full range of business process outsourcing services to long-term care insurance providers, including underwriting, policy issuance, policy administration, claims administration, cognitive assessments and actuarial analyses.
Through its management of more than 1.5 million LTC policies, 60,000 active claims and 140,000 claims transactions per month, LTCG is one of the largest third-party LTC insurance administrators in the industry.

Safe-Guard is a leading provider of customized protection products in the Finance and Insurance (“F&I”) space to the automotive, powersports, RV and marine industries.
Safe-Guard’s protection products platform delivers solutions to top retailers, Original Equipment Manufacturers and independent agents across the United States and Canada. The company develops, markets and administers F&I programs on behalf of its clients and matches them with customer service, advanced technology and analytics solutions based on 30 years of data and sales and marketing expertise.

AmTrust Financial is a multinational property and casualty insurance company specializing in coverage for small businesses.
Through its primary insurance subsidiaries rated “A-” (Excellent) by A.M. Best, the company offers property and casualty insurance products, including workers’ compensation, commercial automobile, general liability and extended service and warranty coverage.

AXIS, a Bermuda-based global insurance and reinsurance company, was formed in November 2001 in response to the significant market dislocation that occurred following the events of September 11, 2001.
The company focuses on specialty insurance lines, such as marine and energy, aviation and aerospace, war, commercial property and political risk, as well as a number of property and specialty classes of reinsurance. AXIS trades on the NYSE: AXS.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
AXIS was the first and largest de novo company formation after the events of September 11, 2001. Critical to its early success was the strength of Stone Point’s network and sponsorship.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point’s relationships with leading brokers accelerated the launch of the business and helped establish the company as a leading underwriter of specialized risks.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point recruited the senior management team to lead AXIS and recruited a “best-in-class” board of directors.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
As lead investor, Stone Point assembled the equity sponsor group, which capitalized the company with $1.7 billion initially. This substantial capital raise facilitated the company’s A.M. Best rating.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
We assisted with AXIS’s immediate launch, including securing infrastructure and regulatory and rating agency approvals. Stone Point also helped the company’s management team create a budgeting process and develop strategic and financial reviews of key initiatives.
EXIT STRATEGY
Stone Point was instrumental in AXIS’s initial public offering.

Enstar is a leading acquiror and manager of insurance and reinsurance companies and portfolios in run-off and provides management, consulting and other services to the global insurance and reinsurance industry.
Enstar has expanded into active underwriting with its acquisitions of Atrium Underwriting Group Ltd. and StarStone Insurance Holdings Ltd. (formerly Torus Insurance Holdings), as well as its launch of reinsurance company KaylaRe Ltd. Trident II invested in Castlewood in 2001, which was subsequently acquired by Enstar.
Enstar is traded on the NYSE: ESGR.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point’s long history of investing in the insurance industry was a tremendous help to Enstar in the expansion into active underwriting with the acquisitions of StarStone and Atrium.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point helped Enstar achieve market validation and provided executive introductions to a substantial number of key executives in the insurance industry.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assisted Enstar in deal origination and execution on numerous run-off deals. Additionally, Stone Point assisted in the execution of two investments in the active underwriting business by assisting in due diligence, deal structuring and rating agency communication.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point introduced John Shettle, who served as StarStone’s U.S. CEO and then, Vice Chairman, as well as Norman Brown, who served as U.S. CEO to StarStone. In addition, we actively assisted with the structuring of incentive programs at Atrium and Kayla Re.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point helped Enstar create a formal board structure and institutionalize its operations. We partnered with management to grow the business from 23 employees and $50 million of reserves to approximately 1,200+ employees and more than $7.7 billion of reserves.

PURE is a high-net-worth personal lines program management and insurance underwriter, founded in 2006 by Trident in partnership with Ross Buchmueller and the PURE senior management team.
Operating as PURE (Privilege Underwriters Reciprocal Exchange), the company provides homeowners, automobile, jewelry, art, personal umbrella liability, flood and watercraft insurance coverage tailored to fit the unique needs of its high-net-worth policyholders. The company was launched as a single-state carrier in Florida and currently has licenses across the U.S.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point facilitated introductions with key constituents including rating agencies, regulators and capital providers which were instrumental to PURE’s launch.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point introduced PURE to several large insurance carriers at an executive level, resulting in millions of dollars of investment and enhanced distribution through the carriers’ agency networks. Stone Point’s additional capital and sponsorship led to the Company’s A.M. Best rating of “A-“.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point helped develop various structural alternatives (including forming an MGA with the support of a large carrier) for the business which led to formation of a reciprocal exchange, including prior iterations involving a large insurance carrier to assist with the initial launch of the business.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point identified Ross Buchmueller as an expert in high-net-worth personal lines insurance underwriting and recruited him to launch PURE. Additionally, Stone Point helped to structure management incentives and alignment in the form of an option plan and management investment program.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point led several debt recapitalizations and surplus note capital raises for the reciprocal exchange. Stone Point introduced the Company to XL Catlin, as a minority investor and partner.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point works closely with managers to develop optional and sustainable capital structure that at the same time provides significant financing responsibility.

Wilton Re is a life (re)insurance company specializing in the acquisition of in force life insurance and annuities as well as with assisting life insurance clients with product development, underwriting and new business strategies designed to serve the middle market.
Wilton Re was led by Chris Stroup, who founded the company with Trident in late 2004 and is also an Operating Partner of Stone Point. Wilton Re’s focus is the U.S. life insurance market where it provides risk capital and related services including M&A and In Force acquisitions, middle market products, and longevity solutions. Wilton Re also partners with companies to implement new business strategies for middle market sales, with an emphasis on worksite, senior market, and simplified term products.
Industry Knowledge & Network
Stone Point helped Wilton Re write its business plan to launch company. Additionally, we managed the successful $628 million initial equity capital raise and helped the company make presentations to A.M. Best to explain just-in-time capital structure and to obtain its initial “A-” rating.
Introduction to Clients & Partners
The company outsources investment management in order to contain operating risks and to leverage the talents of larger asset management organizations. Stone Point introduced Wilton Re to AAM, which won a mandate to manage part of the fixed income portfolio for Wilton Re. Stone Point also helped originate a material private investment opportunity (Harbinger convertible preferred), which was a very successful investment for Wilton Re.
M&A Sourcing
Stone Point sourced Wilton Re’s acquisition of Texas Life (and nine years later this has proven to be Wilton Re’s most successful and enduring franchise investments), and provided a letter of support to the seller in order to add credibility to the proposal. Texas Life became the platform for the company’s primary life insurance business, representing approximately 20% of its underwriting margin at the time of exit.
Business & Product Development
Stone Point helped Wilton Re research the market opportunity for longevity solutions (a new business segment) through its work in the life settlements and pensions buyouts sub-sectors.
Executive Recruiting & Alignment
Stone Point helped to recruit Wilton Re’s former CEO Chris Stroup, and its CIO Perry Braun, as well as the Head of Longevity Solutions, Cormac Treanor. Additionally, Stone Point created an equity incentive program tailored for just-in-time capital.
Capital Raising & Structuring
Stone Point assembled the equity sponsor group for Wilton Re, and executed two follow-on rounds of capital at progressively higher valuations in order to fund Wilton Re’s growth. Stone Point supported buybacks from certain distressed shareholders at accretive valuations.
Exit Strategy
Stone Point identified a non-traditional buyer as a good long-term owner of Wilton Re, and educated the buyer on the strategic benefits of owning the company.

Access Point Financial is a hospitality financing firm offering full-service lending.
Launched in 2011, Access Point Financial specializes in capital expenditure loans and transitional mortgage loans to franchisees of major hotel brands throughout the United States. The company develops lending programs that are endorsed, marketed and supported by the franchisors (i.e., the hotel brands).
Introduction to Clients & Partners
Stone Point introduced Access Point to our network of lending relationships to help secure warehouse funding. Additionally, Stone Point introduced Access Point to prospective borrowers and sources of business, such as franchisors and CMBS special servicers, as well as to other Trident portfolio companies and relationships who completed Access Point’s securitizations.
Operational Assistance & Governance
Stone Point worked closely with the Access Point management team in the formation of the business, in particular assisting with recruiting and selecting third-party servicers and vendors.
Exit Strategy
Stone Point facilitated the sale of Access Point to a partner who has significant ability to contribute to the company’s ongoing growth.
industry: Lending & Markets, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Amherst Pierpont Securities is a fixed-income broker-dealer.
Amherst Pierpont was formed in 2010 as a de novo broker-dealer focused on the U.S. government securities market. In October 2014, Amherst Holdings and Pierpont Securities closed on the combination of their broker-dealer businesses, which were renamed Amherst Pierpont Securities. The company provides its customers, including institutional investors, hedge funds and asset managers, with liquidity and execution services in connection with trading U.S. treasury securities, government-sponsored entity securities, mortgage-backed securities, credit and repurchase agreements.
industry: Lending & Markets, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Achieve (formerly Freedom Financial) is a provider of consumer debt consolidation services and originates consumer and small business loans.
The company is comprised of three consumer-focused businesses: (i) Freedom Debt Relief, the nation’s largest debt settlement business, (ii) Bills.com, which generates mortgage and unsecured consumer lending leads and (iii) Freedom Asset Management, an unsecured marketplace lender.
industry: Asset Management, Business Services, Lending & Markets

company_description:
Preston Hollow is an independent specialty finance company focused on directly originated and negotiated municipal project finance transactions.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Based upon Stone Point’s experience in the broader credit markets, the firm identified Preston Hollow’s focus on the specialty municipal finance market as a growth opportunity that was not efficiently funded by traditional commercial bank or capital markets participants. Furthermore, Stone Point’s experience with “restarts” of proven, successful financial services management teams was valued by the executives of Preston Hollow.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point advised Preston Hollow management as the team’s proven municipal finance business plan, which had previously been pursued within a larger financial conglomerate, was refined to be efficiently executed as a specialty independent finance company.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point partnered with local family office investors to provide the initial round of institutional equity capital for Preston Hollow. Over the subsequent two years, Stone Point has assisted management with raising over $500 million of additional equity capital commitments from Stone Point limited partners. Additionally, Stone Point has assisted management with introductions to banks, rating agencies and potential co-investors that can provide debt capital funding to Preston Hollow originated transactions.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point worked with the founders of Preston Hollow to establish long-term employee equity incentive plans. Management and Stone Point developed governance structures appropriate for a privately financed firm with substantial institutional capital shareholders.

TriState Capital Holdings, Inc., is a publicly traded Pittsburgh, PA-based bank holding company (NASDAQ: TSC) with two wholly owned subsidiary operating companies, TriState Capital Bank and Chartwell Investment Partners, LLC.
TriState Capital Bank is a commercial bank focused on providing commercial and private banking and niche investment management products and services to corporate, institutional and high-net-worth clients, including clients within the wealth management industry.

CoreLogic is a leading provider of property insights and solutions to the residential real estate ecosystem. 
Through its property data solutions, services and technologies, CoreLogic enables housing market participants to help millions of people find, buy and protect their homes.
industry: Insurance Services, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Kensington Vanguard National Land Services is one of the largest independent national title insurance and settlement agencies in the United States.
The company provides commercial and residential title insurance, real property and cooperative lien searches, settlement services, escrow services, recording services and 1031 exchange services. As of December 2022, the company was licensed in more than 30 states with office locations in Arizona, Florida, Missouri, New Jersey, New York, Texas and Virginia.
industry: Insurance Services, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Lancaster Pollard is a leading commercial real estate mortgage and investment banking firm focused on the senior-living and healthcare sectors.
Lancaster Pollard originates mortgage loans for senior living, community healthcare and affordable housing properties. In addition, the company underwrites and places debt with institutional buyers through its broker-dealer subsidiary and has established an investment management platform to invest in senior living properties.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point helped Lancaster Pollard attain a consulting engagement through an introduction to Formation Capital, a Trident VI portfolio company. Additionally, Stone Point provided introductions to several potential investors for the Propero funds, Lancaster Pollard’s private equity funds.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point provided an introduction to a senior care operator in Vermont, resulting in an M&A sell side engagement.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point utilized its network of relationships and expertise to help Lancaster Pollard enhance its product offerings and expand into tangential, niche lending markets.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point helped recruit senior management to lead the buildout of Lancaster Pollard’s M&A advisory group.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point provided additional capital to fund the expansion growth of Propero, Lancaster Pollard’s private equity investment platform.
Stone Point also provided bridge financing to facilitate the growth of Lancaster Pollard’s on-balance sheet lending business.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point assisted in the transition of the executive management team during its investment period.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Meridian Capital Group is a leading U.S. commercial real estate finance, investment sales and retail leasing advisor. 
The company advises a wide range of clients including individual owners, REITs, private equity funds and pension funds. Meridian specializes in a broad array of property types including office, retail, multifamily, hotel, mixed-use, industrial, and healthcare and senior housing properties.

The company was formed in June 2019 with the merger of Situs Group LLC and American Mortgage Consultants (AMC), both Trident portfolio companies. Trident VI invested in Situs in March 2015, and Trident VII invested in AMC in March 2018.
SitusAMC offers a comprehensive set of services and technology to domestic and international banks, private equity investors, pension funds, secondary market guarantors, non-bank mortgage originators and servicers, and numerous other participants in the commercial and residential real estate markets. SitusAMC’s service offerings include consulting and advisory services, underwriting and due diligence, servicing and asset management, claims management, valuations, mortgage servicing rights and whole loan brokerage, talent solutions, and technology solutions including warehouse management, conduit management, collateral management, document management, overall capitalization rate indexing, data extraction, portfolio management and remittance reconciliation among others.

Ascensus is a leading provider of technology-enabled administration services to the tax-advantaged savings market. 
Ascensus primarily serves as an independent retirement plan recordkeeper, retirement plan third-party administrator and 529 plan administrator. The company serves over 15 million savers across the United States with more than $740 billion in assets under administration.

Black Mountain Systems is a leading provider of innovative workflow software solutions to credit investors and alternative asset managers
The company’s clients, which include leading managers of fixed income and alternative assets in the U.S. and Europe, utilize Black Mountain’s Everest platform to increase operating efficiency and reduce risk.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point assisted Black Mountain with sales and marketing, including numerous successful client introductions. Stone Point supported management with the expansion into new client end markets, including direct lending, commercial banks, alternative assets, investment consultants and insurance companies.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point leveraged its experience in the asset & wealth management technology software space to guide management’s focus toward maximizing higher-value, recurring-revenue streams and helped streamline the contracting process to enhance client retention and growth. Stone Point also implemented best governance practices at the board level and introduced value-added independent directors.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point played a key role in helping Black Mountain execute its first tuck-in acquisition, which improved the company’s competitive positioning in direct lending.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point facilitated all of Black Mountain’s third-party debt financings, providing capital to make distributions and to complete its first acquisition. Stone Point also assisted in creating a management incentive plan to increase alignment and management participation in value creation.
industry: Asset Management, Wealth Management & Fund Administration

company_description:
Focus Financial Partners is a leading partnership of fiduciary wealth management firms.
Focus provides access to best practices, resources and continuity planning for its partner firms who serve individuals, families, employers and institutions with wealth management, benefits consulting and investment consulting services. Focus’s partner firms benefit from the synergies, scale, economics and best practices of a market leader to achieve their business objectives.

Kestra is a leading national wealth management platform supporting more than 2,400 independent financial advisors in delivering comprehensive financial planning and investment services to their clients.
Kestra Financial empowers independent financial professionals, including traditional and hybrid registered investment advisors, to provide superior client service.
Kestra (formerly known as NFP Advisor Services) was initially formed in 2000 within National Financial Partners (NFP) to provide the company’s insurance brokers with a broker-dealer platform to enable them to sell investment securities. As the business grew, it began to service independent financial advisors outside of NFP, evolving into a national wealth management platform with over 1,700 advisors and $114 billion of assets under advisement. NFP and Kestra management came to the conclusion that the business was non-core to NFP’s legacy insurance brokerage operations and were looking for a partner to support the business through its spinout from the parent and invest in the platform and team in order to help the company continue to scale and grow. In June 2016, Stone Point completed a recapitalization of the business, becoming the company’s new majority shareholder, with NFP and management retaining a significant minority equity stake. NFP and Kestra management opted to work with Stone Point on this transaction given our significant experience within the wealth management space as well as our expertise in supporting portfolio companies through additional capital and support for tuck-in acquisitions. In 2019, Stone Point and NFP sold a majority interest in the business to funds managed by Warburg Pincus, with Stone Point retaining a minority equity position and holding a seat on the company’s board.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point leveraged its deep network within asset and wealth management to make several strategic introductions to Kestra, including leading asset managers, technology vendors and key industry executives. Stone Point supported the business through its rebranding from NFP Advisor Services into Kestra and was helpful in crafting the go-forward marketing strategy in order to position Kestra within the industry as a differentiated platform with a focus on a high quality, highly productive advisors.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point supported Kestra as it made significant technological improvements to its platform. This helped cement Kestra’s position as a market leader for the industry’s most productive advisors and turned the company’s technology into a key competitive advantage when recruiting new advisors. In addition, Stone Point helped Kestra build a best-in-class investment platform supported by centralized due-diligence specialists and third-party partners, hired a dedicated head of retirement services, and added trust services to Kestra’s offerings through an acquisition.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point worked with Kestra to develop a multi-pronged M&A effort and establish an acquisition platform. Stone Point helped Kestra source and execute 23 acquisitions, which has expanded Kestra’s market presence in key services and helped increase the company’s EBITDA by ~300% since the time of Stone Point’s initial investment.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Following the spinout from NFP, Stone Point assisted Kestra with the recruitment of an experienced CFO and as well as an operations leader. Stone Point also helped Kestra expand its recruiting team and started an internal sales desk to further lead generation.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point facilitated all of the company’s third-party debt financings, which have been critical in the company’s ability to successfully execute on its M&A strategy. Stone Point also led a minority recapitalization with a longstanding Stone Point relationship that resulted in liquidity for both management and Trident while strengthening the company’s equity base and access to additional capital.

Newport Group is a leading independent provider of retirement plans, insurance and consulting services.
The company has more than $300 billion in corporate retirement and insurance assets, encompassing over 1 million plan participants across the United States. In 2022, Newport Group was acquired by Ascensus, another leading provider of technology-enabled administration services to the tax-advantaged savings market and a Trident VIII portfolio company.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point helped Newport grow its presence in the BOLI administration market through a partnership with Greenspoint (formerly Clark Consulting), which added over $35 billion of BOLI assets under administration.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assisted with four acquisitions, making Newport the then second largest independent retirement service provider and the nation’s leading administrator of COLI/BOLI.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point established a management equity incentive plan to align the interests of all stakeholders and promote growth in equity value.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point assisted management in identifying acquisition synergies, which resulted in significant expense savings and EBITDA margin expansion.

Alliant Insurance Services is a leading specialty insurance broker placing P&C and employee benefits coverages on behalf of clients throughout the U.S.
The company provides property and casualty insurance and employee benefit services to more than 55,000 clients served nationwide, including public entities, tribal nations, healthcare, energy, law firms, real estate, construction and other industry groups. Alliant is based in Newport Beach, California, and has offices throughout the United States.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
As of our initial investment in Alliant, Stone Point had been studying the insurance distribution “elephant” for more than 15 years and has completed numerous investments in the industry. In addition, we have completed a number of investments in various forms of insurance underwriters and services providers to the industry. We studied Alliant extensively before its 2005 LBO and tracked the company thereafter.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
We have facilitated introductions for Alliant to other portfolio companies as well as to broader relationships, leading to millions of dollars of recurring annual revenue for Alliant.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point assists management with all material add-on acquisitions. We played a key role in helping Alliant acquire Mesirow Insurance Services, one of the Midwest’s leading independent insurance agencies, which increased Alliant’s revenue by more than $100 million.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
We have leveraged our network to enhance Alliant’s existing insurance carrier relationships and to facilitate new carrier introductions. We have also helped the company evaluate business line expansion opportunities and alternative distribution strategies.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
We have led the process for all of Alliant’s financings since the initial investment in 2015.

Applied Systems is the leading global provider of cloud-based software to the P&C and benefits insurance industries. 
Recognized as a pioneer in insurance automation, the company provides agency and brokerage management systems to customers throughout North America and Europe. Applied is based in University Park, Illinois, and has offices throughout the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom and the Republic of Ireland.

Kroll is a leading provider of technology-enabled professional and business services, supporting clients with risk and financial advisory solutions. 
The company has an established franchise and diverse list of clients, including approximately half of the companies in the S&P 500 and many of the largest private equity firms, hedge funds and law firms.

Focus Financial Partners is a leading partnership of fiduciary wealth management firms.
Focus provides access to best practices, resources and continuity planning for its partner firms who serve individuals, families, employers and institutions with wealth management, benefits consulting and investment consulting services. Focus’s partner firms benefit from the synergies, scale, economics and best practices of a market leader to achieve their business objectives.

Gordon Brothers is a global advisory, restructuring and investment firm. 
Since 1903, Gordon Brothers has helped businesses maximize liquidity and asset values through its people, expertise and capital. The firm’s integrated solutions across asset services, trading and lending give clients the insights, strategies and time to optimize asset values throughout the business cycle. With over 30 offices globally, Gordon Brothers works across the full spectrum of assets with expertise in retail, commercial, industrial, brands and real estate.

Cross Ocean Partners is a credit-focused asset management platform investing globally in stressed and distressed investment opportunities in a broad range of asset classes.
Cross Ocean invests in asset classes including corporate loans and bonds, hard assets, commercial real estate, liquidations and structured credit. Cross Ocean was launched by Chief Executive Officer Graham Goldsmith and Trident. The company acquired its European Special Situations investment platform in July 2015 and has $7.3 billion of AUM as of September 30, 2023.

Eagle Point is an asset manager formed in 2012 by Trident and Tom Majewski. Eagle Point invests in structured credit securities, including the equity and junior debt tranches of collateralized loan obligations (CLOs) as well as debt of BDCs and loan funds.
Eagle Point has focused on investing in majority equity stakes in newly issued CLOs managed by proven collateral managers. As the majority equity investor in these CLOs, Eagle Point negotiates preferred economic terms that enable the funds to generate enhanced returns.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point’s relationships across the structured finance landscape, including with investment banks, CLO managers and private equity issuers, have facilitated Eagle Point’s growth.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point capitalized on its close relationships with investment banks to attract underwriting interest in Eagle Point, which at the time had only a 1.5-year track-record. Stone Point’s relationship ensured senior-level focus on a relatively small public offering for Eagle Point Credit Company (NYSE: ECC), which has subsequently been upsized through follow-on offerings.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point has provided ongoing assistance in evaluating acquisitions and organic expansion opportunities, most notably the December 2016 acquisition of a CLO platform (rebranded as Marble Point Credit Management), which was subsequently sold to Investcorp in 2023.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
At the company’s outset, Stone Point collaborated with Eagle Point’s senior management team to develop a business plan, financial model and fund structuring. Trident has provided seed capital to launch each of the company’s new product initiatives.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point has helped management build the necessary infrastructure as well as recruit additional candidates to broaden and strengthen the team over time.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has facilitated introductions that have led to more than $2 billion of third-party capital, primarily from Trident fund limited partners and other close relationships.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point provided Eagle Point with back-office, compliance and legal support as the company was developing its infrastructure. Stone Point has made introductions to leading third-party vendors to provide compliance and HR assistance, where appropriate.

Freepoint Commodities is a merchant of physical commodities and a financer of upper- and mid-stream commodity-producing assets.
In addition, the company provides physical supply services and related structured solutions for counterparties. The company was founded in 2011 by Trident V and a senior management team that previously led Sempra Energy Trading Corporation and its successor company from 1998 until 2009.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point facilitated an introduction to a Trident fund limited partner that invested equity alongside Freepoint in an acquisition of a midstream pipeline. Stone Point’s relationships with investors have helped Freepoint secure investors for its merchant banking deals.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point helped Freepoint evaluate a number of strategic acquisitions. In addition, Stone Point helped the company acquire a proprietary trading system.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point provided additional equity capital to expand Freepoint’s product line and geographic presence.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point provided significant assistance in recruiting several top traders and assisted the founders in developing an incentive program for key management.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point provided bridge financing to support a large acquisition, and helped to negotiate the initial line of credit.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point provided significant assistance with the build-out of Freepoint’s infrastructure, including helping to identify office space, developing an operating budget, and selecting technology and other vendors.

Henderson Park Capital is a real estate asset management platform that targets multi-strategy, value-add and opportunistic real estate investments in major European markets and the U.S. Henderson Park has invested over $13 billion across all major real estate asset classes in prime locations in Europe and U.S.
The company focuses on acquiring and repositioning assets that are undermanaged, underutilized or require a repositioned capital structure. Henderson Park was launched by Nick Weber and Trident VI in May 2016.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point leveraged its network to introduce Henderson Park to its LPs, potential investments and operating partners.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
