Stone Point assisted management with setting the strategic direction of the business, as well as with the selection and structuring of agreement with fund placement agent.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point assisted in recruiting and interviewing several senior hires.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point was integral to Henderson Park’s fundraising for its first fund, including introducing Henderson Park to our network of limited partners and other relationships, which resulted in several Trident LPs investing in Henderson Park’s fund including two of our existing LPs acting as cornerstone investors in the fund (with a $250 million LP investment). Additionally, Stone Point assisted in negotiating the fund’s subscription facility, and assisted in the fundraising of Henderson Park’s next two institutional funds and various co-investment vehicles.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point leveraged its experience in launching asset managers to provide guidance on the build-out of Henderson Park’s infrastructure.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
KaylaRe was a Class 4 reinsurer, which offered a diversified range of specialty reinsurance. 
The company was acquired in full by Enstar in 2018.

Black Mountain Systems is a leading provider of innovative workflow software solutions to credit investors and alternative asset managers
The company’s clients, which include leading managers of fixed income and alternative assets in the U.S. and Europe, utilize Black Mountain’s Everest platform to increase operating efficiency and reduce risk.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point assisted Black Mountain with sales and marketing, including numerous successful client introductions. Stone Point supported management with the expansion into new client end markets, including direct lending, commercial banks, alternative assets, investment consultants and insurance companies.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point leveraged its experience in the asset & wealth management technology software space to guide management’s focus toward maximizing higher-value, recurring-revenue streams and helped streamline the contracting process to enhance client retention and growth. Stone Point also implemented best governance practices at the board level and introduced value-added independent directors.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point played a key role in helping Black Mountain execute its first tuck-in acquisition, which improved the company’s competitive positioning in direct lending.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point facilitated all of Black Mountain’s third-party debt financings, providing capital to make distributions and to complete its first acquisition. Stone Point also assisted in creating a management incentive plan to increase alignment and management participation in value creation.
industry: Asset Management, Wealth Management & Fund Administration

company_description:
Broadstone Net Lease (“BNL”) is an internally-managed real estate investment trust (“REIT”) focused on single-tenant commercial real estate properties in the United States.
Broadstone Net Lease is an internally-managed REIT that acquires, owns and manages primarily single-tenant commercial real estate properties that are net leased on a long-term basis to a diversified group of tenants. BNL’s diversified portfolio consists of properties in the U.S. and Canada across the industrial, healthcare, restaurant, retail and office property types.
Stone Point originally invested in BNL’s investment manager, Broadstone Real Estate (“BRE”), which served as the investment manager for BNL and Broadtree Residential (“BTR”), a private real estate investment vehicle that invests in multifamily properties in multiple U.S. markets. In 2020, through a series of transactions involving the acquisition of the manager, BNL and its board of directors internalized the external management functions performed for BNL by Broadstone Real Estate and its affiliates, resulting in Stone Point’s ownership of BNL’s REIT shares.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point sourced several property investments for Broadstone Net Lease. Stone Point has also sourced and helped evaluate a number of potential acquisition opportunities.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
During its ownership of the investment manager, Stone Point helped BRE evaluate strategic opportunities, including expanding the Broadtree Residential vehicle into multifamily investments and launching new investment vehicles. Stone Point also helped assess BRE’s decision to sell its single-family homes portfolio and outsource property management for its residential properties. Additionally, through the internalization of the manager, BNL will benefit from a simplified structure, immediate cost savings related to fees associated with BRE, and further alignment of the management team within BNL.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has assisted BRE in raising additional equity for its investment vehicles through introducing the company to wealth advisory firms and other distribution partners within our network. Additionally, Stone Point helped BRE raise third-party debt for the first time at the manager and helped increase its lender group in its investment vehicle.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point worked with BRE’s management to put in place an equity participation plan for a broad set of employees to improve alignment.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Enhanced Capital is an asset manager focusing on lower middle market lending and an agent specializing in tax credits and other government incentives.
In 2014, Enhanced Capital and Trident announced the formation of Tree Line Capital. Tree Line, which joined Enhanced Capital’s family of specialty credit funds, focuses on direct lending to businesses with EBITDA of $3 to $25 million.

Harbor Group Consulting is a leading insurance consultant and due diligence advisor to the commercial real estate and commercial lending industries.
The company serves a diverse client base including large commercial banks, capital markets lenders and other financial institutions.
industry: Insurance Services, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
PURE is a high-net-worth personal lines program management and insurance underwriter, founded in 2006 by Trident in partnership with Ross Buchmueller and the PURE senior management team.
Operating as PURE (Privilege Underwriters Reciprocal Exchange), the company provides homeowners, automobile, jewelry, art, personal umbrella liability, flood and watercraft insurance coverage tailored to fit the unique needs of its high-net-worth policyholders. The company was launched as a single-state carrier in Florida and currently has licenses across the U.S.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point facilitated introductions with key constituents including rating agencies, regulators and capital providers which were instrumental to PURE’s launch.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point introduced PURE to several large insurance carriers at an executive level, resulting in millions of dollars of investment and enhanced distribution through the carriers’ agency networks. Stone Point’s additional capital and sponsorship led to the Company’s A.M. Best rating of “A-“.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point helped develop various structural alternatives (including forming an MGA with the support of a large carrier) for the business which led to formation of a reciprocal exchange, including prior iterations involving a large insurance carrier to assist with the initial launch of the business.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point identified Ross Buchmueller as an expert in high-net-worth personal lines insurance underwriting and recruited him to launch PURE. Additionally, Stone Point helped to structure management incentives and alignment in the form of an option plan and management investment program.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point led several debt recapitalizations and surplus note capital raises for the reciprocal exchange. Stone Point introduced the Company to XL Catlin, as a minority investor and partner.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point works closely with managers to develop optional and sustainable capital structure that at the same time provides significant financing responsibility.

First Data is the largest merchant acquirer, issuer processor and independent network services provider in the world.
The company enables businesses to accept electronic payments, helping financial institutions issue credit, debit and prepaid cards, and route secure transactions between them.

MetLife, headquartered in New York City, is a leading provider of individual insurance, annuities and investment products, as well as group insurance and retirement and savings products to individual and institutional customers.

NFP is a leading insurance broker and consultant that provides employee benefits, property & casualty, retirement and individual private client solutions.
The company is the 13th largest insurance broker in the U.S. and 7th largest benefits broker globally based on the 2023 Business Insurance rankings.

OneWest is a California-based bank holding company that was established to purchase certain assets of IndyMac Federal Bank, FSB after IndyMac was placed into conservatorship under the control of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation in July 2008.
IndyMac was a regional savings and loan institution based in southern California that historically focused on originating single-family mortgage loans.
Trident IV was part of the investor group that led the formation of OneWest, a new savings and loan association, to acquire substantially all of the assets of IndyMac from the government following the failure of IndyMac in the summer of 2008. As part of the transaction OneWest entered into loss share agreements that provided meaningful protection on a large portion of the single-family mortgage portfolio acquired by OneWest.
Through the course of the consortium’s ownership, OneWest Bank successfully transitioned from an asset‐focused thrift to one of the leading regional banks in the Southern California market. In August 2015, OneWest closed on its sale to CIT Group (NYSE: CIT) for $3.4 billion in cash and stock. The combined CIT/OneWest bank had more than 70 branches, $65 billion in assets and $30 billion in deposits.
industry: Lending & Markets, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
The Principal Financial Group is a leading provider of retirement savings, investment and insurance products and services based in Des Moines, Iowa.
The U.S. and international operations concentrate primarily on asset management and accumulation. In addition, the company offers a broad range of individual life and disability insurance, group life and health insurance, and residential mortgage loan origination and servicing in the U.S.

Carlile was one of several investments pursued by Stone Point to benefit from the substantial cost savings and earning accretion generated by consolidation in the commercial banking industry.
During the period of financial distress and depressed valuations surrounding the 2008-2009 Financial Crisis in the United States, Stone Point proactively identified several geographic regions in which bank consolidation was likely to become particularly active and profitable for acquirers. One of those regions was Texas and the broader southwest. After meeting with several dozen banks and management teams based in the area, Stone Point chose to partner with Carlile Founder and CEO Tom Nichols to lead a growth capital investment in the established Carlile holding company. Tom and his management team had a long history of successfully recapitalizing, managing and profitably selling banks in the Texas market.
After committing to an investment in Carlile, Stone Point assisted Tom Nichols in raising a total of over $325 million of equity capital to support Carlile’s consolidation driven business plan. Over the subsequent six years, Carlile deployed investors’ capital through eight bank and branch acquisitions, to ultimately develop a franchise with $2.2 billion of assets and 42 branch locations. After fully consolidating and optimizing the earnings of the acquired operations, Carlile decided to put itself up for sale in order to capitalize on the company’s increased net income. This ultimately led to an acquisition of Carlile by Independent Bank, a larger publicly traded bank consolidator in Texas. In order to continue to benefit from the earnings accretion that Independent Bank would likely realize from the consolidation of Carlile, Stone Point and Tom Nichols chose to join the Independent Bank board and accept the acquirer’s common stock as merger consideration.
status_current: Past							 | Acquired by Independent Bank Group

company_description:
Businessolver is a leading provider of employee benefits administration technology.
Businessolver provides its clients and their employees with a full suite of software and services to shop for, enroll in and utilize employee benefits and offers add-on products, including a consumer-directed healthcare platform, a voluntary benefits marketplace and personalized benefits navigation tools.
Businessolver’s proprietary technology platform powers the full range of the employee health benefits experience, including core medical, consumer-directed healthcare accounts, voluntary benefits and personalized benefits navigation.

Citco is a leading global provider of administrative services for the alternative asset management industry.
With over 11,500 employees and offices in more than 37 countries, the company provides independent fund administration, middle office, custody and banking services to hedge fund, fund of hedge fund and private equity clients, as well as trust services to multinational corporations and high net worth individuals.

ClearPoint Health is a full-service medical stop-loss captive platform.
ClearPoint is an employee health benefits platform that utilizes medical stop-loss captive solutions to provide affordable, self-funded health insurance to small and mid-sized businesses.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Distribution, Insurance Services

company_description:
CREA is a leading low-income housing tax credit (LIHTC) syndicator and asset manager, providing innovative financial solutions that contribute to the creation of affordable housing across the country.
Since inception in 2001, CREA has raised $10.3 billion of equity to develop and preserve more than 77,000 affordable homes across the U.S. Stone Point invested in CREA in 2016 as a tuck-in acquisition for the Omni platform, and retained its interest in CREA following the sale of Omni in 2023.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Cross Ocean Partners is a credit-focused asset management platform investing globally in stressed and distressed investment opportunities in a broad range of asset classes.
Cross Ocean invests in asset classes including corporate loans and bonds, hard assets, commercial real estate, liquidations and structured credit. Cross Ocean was launched by Chief Executive Officer Graham Goldsmith and Trident. The company acquired its European Special Situations investment platform in July 2015 and has $7.3 billion of AUM as of September 30, 2023.

DMG Bancshares is a bank holding company building a West Coast regional community bank.
Through its platform bank, California First National, DMG is building a regional community bank through organic growth and acquisitions. DMG is led by the former management team of Grandpoint Capital, a Trident IV portfolio company.

EverBank is a Jacksonville, FL-based privately held commercial bank with more than $35 billion in assets as of June 2023.

EverBank operates a diversified commercial bank with a national lending franchise and scalable deposit platform.

Hyphen Solutions is a leading project management and payment management software platform that services the residential construction industry in North America.
The company provides builders, installers and manufacturers with industry-leading supply chain scheduling, procurement and collaboration solutions. Hyphen also offers an advanced invoice and payment solution for homebuilders to pay suppliers, trades and vendors. The company serves 24 of the top 26 home builders in North America.

IEQ Capital is a leading independent wealth management firm and alternative investment solutions provider.
IEQ is an independent RIA that provides wealth management advice and family office services to ultra-high net worth families primarily located in Silicon Valley, Los Angeles, New York City and Austin. IEQ has a differentiated investment model focused on creating tax-efficient, endowment-style portfolios with meaningful allocations to niche (non-bank platform) alternative investments. As of December 31, 2023, IEQ had $23+ billion of RAUM.
industry: Asset Management, Wealth Management & Fund Administration

company_description:
Lincoln Property Company is one of the nation’s largest diversified commercial real estate operating companies offering a comprehensive suite of services. 
Lincoln manages, leases, develops and provides investment management and advisory services to owners and occupiers of office, life science, retail, industrial, data center, production studio and mixed-use properties throughout the United States and Europe. Lincoln’s combined management and leasing portfolio includes more than 470 million square feet of commercial space. In addition to providing third-party real estate services, Lincoln manages $6 billion of real estate assets and has principally acquired and developed more than $24 billion and 62 million square feet of commercial projects since 2018.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
Lone Wolf is a leading provider of residential real estate technology for agents, brokers, franchises, MLSs and associations across North America.
Lone Wolf provides a variety of software solutions, including front-office products (digital marketing automation, lead generation and customer relationship management), back-office products (accounting, marketing insights and agent performance, benchmarking and recruiting) and transaction management solutions. Lone Wolf’s products are used by more than 1.5 million agents, 10,000 brokerages, 20,000 offices and 1,000 MLSs and associations.

Onboard Partners (formerly Kessler Group) is a leading B2B services and consulting platform focused primarily on the consumer lending and credit card sectors in North America. 
Onboard helps clients grow and optimize consumer credit portfolios by facilitating partnerships, performing asset management (FIDEM) and providing a suite of performance marketing services.
industry: Asset Management, Business Services, Lending & Markets

company_description:
Prima is a registered investment advisor specializing in commercial mortgage investments.
With approximately $9.5 billion of assets under management as of December 2023, Prima primarily invests in commercial mortgage whole loans, investment grade CMBS and REIT bonds. Prima, which is based in Scarsdale, New York, invests throughout the United States and across various commercial real estate debt asset classes, including the office, retail, multifamily and industrial sectors.
industry: Asset Management, Real Estate Finance & Services

company_description:
PrismHR is a leading provider of payroll, benefits and HR software for the Professional Employer Organization (“PEO”) and Administrative Service Organization (“ASO”) industries.
Based in Hopkinton, MA, PrismHR serves small- to medium-sized business clients, representing approximately 2 million worksite employees, through its software platform.

Private Client Select is a leading Managing General Agency (“MGA”) serving the High-Net-Worth personal lines insurance industry, formed in partnership with AIG. 
PCS offers property and casualty personal insurance solutions and risk management services that meet the unique needs of High-Net-Worth clients throughout the United States.

Sabal is a commercial real estate investment management platform focused on structured credit, lending and opportunistic equity investments. 
Sabal currently manages $1.3 billion of capital across five funds. In addition, Sabal has an agency trading business that structures and securitizes agency securities.

SambaSafety is a leading provider of cloud-based risk management software and data for organizations with drivers in North America and the U.K. SambaSafety serves more than 15,000 organizations, including employers, insurance carriers and insurance brokers.
Employers and insurers benefit from SambaSafety’s continuous monitoring, intuitive insights, risk reduction tools and configurable pricing solutions. Through the collection, correlation and analysis of federal, state, local and telematics data sources, SambaSafety’s flexible, end-to-end capabilities enable businesses and insurers to better evaluate and mitigate driving risk, accelerate product development, reduce crashes and foster safer communities.

SunFire is a cloud-based technology platform providing Medicare Advantage, Prescription Drug and Medicare Supplement plan quoting and enrollment solutions for health plans and brokers, including both call centers and field marketing organizations.
SunFire’s platform has approved plan data from over 110 Medicare health plans including Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement insurance plans for the seniors market and direct enrollment integrations with over 63 insurance carriers.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Insurance Distribution

company_description:
Ten-X is the leading online marketplace for residential and commercial real estate.
Ten-X is a business process outsourcing company that is the nation’s leading online real estate marketplace and the parent to Auction.com and Ten-X Commercial.
INDUSTRY KNOWLEDGE & NETWORK
Stone Point played a key role in sourcing and structuring joint ventures for Ten-X with key players in the commercial real estate space, in order to support Ten-X’s expansion into new lines of business.
INTRODUCTION TO CLIENTS & PARTNERS
Stone Point has made significant introductions for Ten-X, including to several of Ten-X’s largest clients, many of which are market leaders and have exclusive relationships with Ten-X. Additionally Stone Point has helped Ten-X establish relationships with various investment banks.
M&A SOURCING
Stone Point helped Ten-X source and execute its acquisition of the retail assets of Commerce Title, as well as helped execute the sale of the company’s non-strategic REO asset management business to a third-party. Additionally, we helped negotiate the acquisition of Rockwood Advisors, and continue to actively explore transactions alongside Ten-X management. At various points in Ten-X’s growth, we have helped bring in additional capital providers and partners, including Google Capital, Starwood, and Fortress.
BUSINESS & PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT
Stone Point has supported Ten-X’s shift from an offline model at the time of initial partnership, to an online model that has become the nation’s leading online real estate marketplace. Throughout its lifecycle, we have supported Ten-X with its expansion into (i) online auctions, (ii) deed-in-lieu of foreclosure sales, (iii) trustee sales, (iv) short sales, (v) commercial real estate and loan note auctions, and (vi) residential and commercial consumer to consumer (C2C) auctions. In 2017, Ten-X entered into a joint venture with Fizber to build out an online marketplace for single family homes using Ten-X’s software capabilities.
EXECUTIVE RECRUITING & ALIGNMENT
Stone Point assisted Ten-X with the recruiting of several senior executives, including the president of default solutions, the EVP of the commercial division, EVP of residential loan sales, and COO of online operations. We have supported the company with several restructurings of its employee incentive program in order to attract and retain top talent.
CAPITAL RAISING & STRUCTURING
Stone Point has been instrumental in helping Ten-X negotiate, raise, and place several rounds of debt. Additionally, we have helped Ten-X seed and fundraise for its specialty lending vehicle.
OPERATIONAL ASSISTANCE & GOVERNANCE
Stone Point assisted management with an initial expense restructuring, which resulted in $8 million of run-rate expense saves, and subsequently with the purchase of the Auction.com domain name. Stone Point principals provide ongoing strategic advice to the company as active members of the Board.

Tree Line Capital is a de novo lower middle-market lending platform.
In 2014, Enhanced Capital and Trident announced the formation of Tree Line Capital. Tree Line, which joined Enhanced Capital’s family of specialty credit funds, focuses on direct lending to businesses with EBITDA of $5 to $30 million.

Truist Insurance Holdings is the fifth largest insurance broker in the U.S, based on 2023 Business Insurance rankings.
Truist Insurance Holdings places over $50 billion of premiums through its retail, wholesale and insurance services business units. Headquartered in Charlotte, NC, the company has more than 10,000 employees across more than 200 offices.

Verisys delivers comprehensive healthcare provider data management. 
Leveraging a cloud-based technology platform, the company credentials, screens and monitors millions of providers annually. It also helps health plans, health systems and state Medicaid agencies improve provider data quality, build and manage provider networks, and publish and maintain provider directories.
industry: Healthcare & Managed Care Services, Human Capital Management
hq: Louisville, KY, & Salt Lake City, UT

company_description:
Vervent is one of the largest third-party servicers of commercial and consumer loan and lease portfolios in the United States.
The company’s service offerings, which include Consumer Loan and Lease Servicing, Commercial Loan and Lease Servicing, Backup Servicing and Call Center Services, empower companies to accelerate business and drive compliance. The company also offers a suite of fully managed credit card products direct-to-consumers. Vervent sets the standard for outperformance in complex service industries by delivering superior industry expertise, future-built technology and meaningful services that are built for speed. Vervent was created through the merger of Portfolio Financial Servicing Company with First Associates Loan Servicing.
industry: Business Services, Wealth Management & Fund Administration
